definition: not care about one's appearance (idiom)/slovenly in dress and manner
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
suffix of a noun of locality

sentences.english: Be careless in your dress if you must, but keep a tidy soul.
sentences.chinese: 必要時可以不修邊幅，但須保持靈魂潔淨。

sentences.english: I be a slovenly and untidy person, don't hope me to dress up to let you see.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個不修邊幅的人，別指望我打扮給你看。

sentences.english: If you run a bank, you can’t look like a slob.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在管理一家銀行，你總不能穿得不修邊幅吧。

sentences.english: The Nordic detective is often careworn and rumpled.
sentences.chinese: 北歐的偵探經常疲憊而不修邊幅。

definition: to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
elderly, as in movement or bearing
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
